channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Vegetation obscuring road markings, 11th September
item.description:
Hilgay Lodge, which borders Tudor Lodge Road, has a lot of vegetation growing out of the fence and into the road. This obscures sight lines for pedestrians, cyclists and cars, and is also covering up some double yellow lines. I have written to the owner to ask if they might cut back some of the bushes but I feel it would be useful for someone from the relevant council department to come and assess the situation and ensure the vegetation is managed on a regular basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tudor Lodge Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing cover from inspection hatch., 11th September
item.description:
Missing cover to hatch is a trip hazard which could cause significant injury. What 3 Words: Firm Share Plug

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Beni Close, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins on cycle path every week (again), 11th September
item.description:
Been reported several times over previous months - every week this is a problem since built. This is supposed to be for cyclists to safely use, what's the point in building infrastructure if its to be abused? It's not only the owners but dustbin collectors doing this also! Previous post appears to have been removed yet not resolved, added once more with (another) photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hubble Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo bin overflowing, 11th September
item.description:

item.title: Tree falling across footpath, 10th September
item.description:
This tree is gradually getting lower and will eventually fall and block footpath and could potentially injure someone. It is only being held up by Ivy growth

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Manor Court, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Willow Tree blocking bridge crossing on footpath, 10th September
item.description:
This has steadily got worse over the past months. At one time it was possible to duck under, but now its virtually impassable. Now the tree has fallen so far it is in danger of damaging the bridge

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Bark Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20"x20" pothole at the edge of the road adjacent to the pavement., 8th September
item.description:
These potholes have been patched up several times but always break down after a spell of rain as a large puddle collects in the dip in the road and traffic going through the water churn up the poor surface of the tarmac. This problem will grow as the winter weather comes along.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shearwater Grove, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty traffic lights, 8th September
item.description:
Filter lane light into Benhall goes Red with the main A40 westbound lights. Filter lane should only turn red when the pedestrian crossing lights are triggered. This is causing unnecessary delays and increased pollution
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign Gravel Walk, 8th September
item.description:
The replacement sign has been sited (too far away from the boundary) this is causing an issue to vehicles, particularly deliveries. The narrowness of the lane has become a real problem. The original sign was located on the wall giving extra width to the lane. The debris and rubble on the left has narrowed the lane even further. Visitors and deliveries refuse to use.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Southam, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown, poor tarmac, 7th September
item.description:
All the way down the alleyway the tarmac is all cracked and there is random lumps of higher tarmac that my pushchair got stuck on and tipped forwards and I nearly went over with it. If it wasn’t for my partner grabbing the pushchair with my 16 week old baby in it! Also seriously over grown with stinging nettles and full of dog poo. It’s used a lot by school runs and it’s dreadful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19a, Ennerdale Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
